subject: Re: [junit] Looking for some "Best Practices"
msgSnippet: ... This is a strange question.  Since you re using Ant, you have access to the  task s nested element .  What are you trying to do that
messageBody:
Quoth Vikas Malla:
> Is ther a java utility that collects all the test names in various
> folders/subfolders, inserts them in the right place in the ant
> build.xml ? This also removes the dependence on the platform.

This is a strange question. Since you're using Ant, you have
access to the <junit> task's nested element <batchtest>. What are
you trying to do that can't be done with this element?
